clinical_study.brief_title: The Lipid Profile of the Skin Surface in Acne
clinical_study.official_title: The Lipid Profile of the Skin Surface in Acne

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the differences in the skin lipid profile of patients with and without acne. Secondly, the goal is to learn more about what the effects of retinoinds (topical and systemic) are on the the skin lipid profile. We hypothesize that the skin lipid profile of subjects with acne will be lower in inflammatory lipids in comparison to subjects without acne.

detailed_description.textblock: Skin lipid profile will be conducted via sebutapes- adhesive tapes that painlessly absorbs sebum from the face. These tapes will be placed on the face for 1 hour. A photograph of the face will be taken during each study visit. A sebumeter will also be used to measure skin sebum secretion rate.

primary_outcome.measure: Skin lipid profile of acne and healthy patients
primary_outcome.description: Compare the skin lipid profile of acne and healthy patients at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Skin lipid profile of acne patients after treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1 month and 4-5 months of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Patients in the topical retinoid group will have their lipids evaluated after 1 month of treatment. Patients in the systemic retinoid (isotretinoin) group will have their lipids evaluated after 1 and 4-5 months of treatment.

arm_group.description: The subjects in this group do not have a history of acne.
These subjects have been prescribed a topical retinoid for their acne. They will participate in the study for a period of 1 month.
These subjects have been prescribed isotretinoin for their acne. They will participate in the study for a period of 5-6 months.

intervention.description: Subjects will apply a pea sized amount of topical retinoid cream once daily at night for 30 days. Subjects will return for a follow-up visit.
Subjects will take one pill once daily for 5 months. Subjects will return after 1 month and after 4-5 months of treatment for skin lipid profiling.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects will be from the UC Davis Dermatology Clinic, surrounding dermatology clinics, from the UC Davis undergraduate campus, and from the California State University Sacramento campus.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 12 to 30 years
- have been prescribed tretinoin OR isotretinoin
Exclusion Criteria:
- those who have taken isotretinoin (systemic)
- those who used tretinoin or other topical retinoid within two weeks of starting the study
- those with seborrheic dermatitis, rosacea, or polycystic ovary syndrome
- those who are pregnant, prisoners, or cognitively impaired
- those who do not fit the inclusion criteria
